definition: the time comes, fortune turns (idiom); to have a lucky break/things change for the better
surname Shi
old variant of 時|时[shi2]
o'clock/time/when/hour/season/period
to come/to arrive/to come round/ever since/next
to move/to transport/to use/to apply/fortune/luck/fate
see 轉文|转文[zhuai3 wen2]
to revolve/to turn/to circle about/to walk about/classifier for revolutions (per minute etc): revs, rpm/classifier for repeated actions
to turn/to change direction/to transfer/to forward (mail)

sentences.english: Delivers you a peach blossom, a change inone's fortune from bad to good depends entirely on it.
sentences.chinese: 送你一只桃花，时来运转全靠它。

sentences.english: Delivers you a peach  blossom, a change inone's fortune from bad to good depends entirely on it.
sentences.chinese: 送你一只桃花，时来运转全靠它。
那天晚上我时来运转了。

sentences.english: We'll get a lucky break soon, sweetheart.
sentences.chinese: 我们很快就会时来运转的，心肝儿。

sentences.english: Send you a large fortune turnes the peach blossom, depend on it.
sentences.chinese: 送你一只大桃花，时来运转全靠它。

sentences.english: Like Mr Clinton, this man can turn on a dime.
sentences.chinese: 奥巴马可以像克林顿一样时来运转。

sentences.english: But  don't forget the times your luck has turned.
sentences.chinese: 但别忘却那时来运转的机遇。

sentences.english: This turn of fortune was unforeseen.
sentences.chinese: 这时来运转是没有预见到的。

sentences.english: Fortune turnes the tables and we won.
At the very moment when he had abandoned the fight, the tide turned. But it had turned too late.
sentences.chinese: 他放弃了战斗，却时来运转了，虽然来得太迟。

sentences.english: But his fortunes began to change almost immediately after he left Miami.
sentences.chinese: 然而，离开迈阿密之后，他开始时来运转。

sentences.english: It'a a stunning reversal of fortune after last year's military coup.
sentences.chinese: 这是去年军事政变后出现的惊人的时来运转。

definition: lit. the salted fish turns over (idiom)/fig. to experience a reversal of fortune
to experience good luck
good luck
to make easy money/to make a fortune/to line one's pockets
lit. the divine steed Feihuang gallops (idiom)/fig. to achieve meteoric success in one's career
our luck is in, everything is going smoothly (idiom)
circumstances/fate
god of wealth/very wealthy man
profits pouring in from all sides (idiom)/raking in money/bonanza
(of a political career) everything is going smoothly (idiom)
to climb step by step/to rise steadily/on the up and up
ill luck/misfortune
joy from heaven (idiom); overjoyed at unexpected good news/unlooked-for happy event
lit. there are principles behind making money (idiom); fig. to have a knack for good business/knowing how to accumulate wealth/good at feathering one's own nest
to get rich
easy money/windfall/ill-gotten gains/undeserved fortune/illegal profit
